channel.title: CAMGDP â€“ social media
channel.description: Recent content in social media on CAMGDP

item.title: Sources: Loyiha
item.description: Founded in 2022, Loyiha is a video podcast platform designed to “inspire and motivate women.” It platforms several women-centered podcast series that provide educational content on various career fields, from marketing to education, as well as information on such topics as misogyny, infertility, ecology, and others.

item.title: Sources: Ariadna
item.description: Launched in 2020, Ariadna is a Central Asia media dedicated to covering the art scene of the region using accessible language. It provides reviews, editorials, and audioguides.

item.title: Sources: Bashtan Bashta
item.description: Founded in 2020, Bashtan Bashta is a podcast series and a social media project dedicated to raising civil consciousness in Kyrgyzstan. It also covers news and politics of other Central Asian countries.

item.title: Sources: Invisible Rainbow Union
item.description: Founded in 2023, Invisible Rainbow Union is a social media community of queer ethnic minorities from Central Asia and Russia. The media focuses on preserving oral histories of the LGBTQIA+ community.

item.title: Sources: Ruyo Journal
item.description: Launched in 2023, Ruyo Journal is an artist-led digital media focused on critical discourse on art, film, and theory in Central Asia. Its goal is to “support the development of a flourishing cultural scene in Central Asia by providing a platform for thoughtful and engaging discussions.”
